intro: Platytheca anasima, commonly known as the narrowleaf false dandelion, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that develop into fluffy, white seed heads, similar to those of the true dandelion. It typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. Platytheca anasima is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to cultivate.
